Benchmark
=========

You can also run a detailed benchmark for a single function using, for
example, the command:

.. code-block:: pycon

Only arrays with data type (dtype) int32, int64, float32, and float64 are
accelerated. All other dtypes result in calls to slower, unaccelerated
functions. In the rare case of a byte-swapped input array (e.g. a big-endian
array on a little-endian operating system) the function will not be
accelerated regardless of dtype.

Install
=======

Bottleneck provides binary wheels on PyPI for all the most common platforms.
Binary packages are also available in conda-forge. We recommend installing binaries
with ``pip``, ``uv``, ``conda`` or similar - it's faster and easier than building
from source.

Installing from source
----------------------

Requirements:

======================== ============================================================================
Bottleneck               Python >=3.9; NumPy 1.16.0+
Compile                  gcc, clang, MinGW or MSVC

usage_description: This library is used to speed up NumPy array operations by leveraging optimized C code, providing significant performance improvements for common array functions. By utilizing Bottleneck's accelerated functions, developers can achieve faster computation times for tasks such as finding the mean of arrays with missing values and calculating moving window means.
